radiographic_examinations.findings: Compact orthohyperkeratosis, acanthosis, prominent eccrine ducts, and focal spongiosis around the eccrine ducts. The dermis was normal.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's problem gradually abated over the course of approximately 1 to 2 years, with no recurrence in the past 3 years.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Compact orthohyperkeratosis and dilation of the eccrine ducts. The dermis and elastic tissue stains were normal.
